def_cn: 公共服务事业;公共服务系统
def_en: A service is something that the public needs, such as transport, communications facilities, hospitals, or energy supplies, which is provided in a planned and organized way by the government or an official body.

def_cn: 公共事业机构(或公司)
def_en: You can sometimes refer to an organization or private company as a particular service when it provides something for the public or acts on behalf of the government.

def_cn: (机构或公司提供的某一)服务
def_en: If an organization or company provides a particular service, they can do a particular job or a type of work for you.

def_cn: 服务业;服务性活动
def_en: Services are activities such as tourism, banking, and selling things which are part of a country's economy, but are not concerned with producing or manufacturing goods.

def_cn: 服务内容;服务(质量);服务态度
def_en: The level or standard of service provided by an organization or company is the amount or quality of the work it can do for you.

def_cn: (公共汽车或火车的)路线，行程车次，班车
def_en: A bus or train service is a route or regular journey that is part of a transport system.

def_cn: (提供技术或帮助的)服务
def_en: Your services are the things that you do or the skills that you use in your job, which other people find useful and are usually willing to pay you for.

def_cn: (为某组织或活动所做的)工作，服务，效劳
def_en: If you refer to someone's service or services to a particular organization or activity, you mean that they have done a lot of work for it or spent a lot of their time on it.

def_cn: 海陆空三军;军队;部队
def_en: The Services are the army, the navy, and the air force.

def_cn: 兵役;作战
def_en: Service is the work done by people or equipment in the army, navy, or air force, for example during a war.

def_cn: (饭店、酒店，商店提供的)服务
def_en: When you receive service in a restaurant, hotel, or shop, an employee asks you what you want or gives you what you have ordered.

def_cn: 宗教礼仪;礼拜仪式
def_en: A service is a religious ceremony that takes place in a church.

def_cn: 整套餐具(或茶具)
def_en: A dinner service or a tea service is a complete set of plates, cups, saucers, and other pieces of china.

def_cn: (高速公路边可加油、购物或用餐的)服务站
def_en: A services is a place beside a motorway where you can buy petrol and other things, or have a meal.

def_cn: (网球、羽毛球等的)发球权，开球局
def_en: In tennis, badminton, and some other sports, when it is your service, it is your turn to serve.

def_cn: (大楼、建筑中的设施）员工专用的，后勤专用的
def_en: Service is used to describe the parts of a building or structure that are used by the staff who clean, repair, or look after it, and are not usually used by the public.

def_cn: 服侍;伺候
def_en: If someone is in service, they are working as a servant.

def_cn: 维修，检修,维护(机器、车辆)
def_en: If you have a vehicle or machine serviced, you arrange for someone to examine, adjust, and clean it so that it will keep working efficiently and safely.

def_cn: (国家、组织)支付(债息)
def_en: If a country or organization services its debts, it pays the interest on them.

def_cn: 为…提供服务;满足…的需求
def_en: If someone or something services an organization, a project, or a group of people, they provide it with the things that it needs in order to function properly or effectively.
active service; Civil Service; community service; emergency services; in-service; National Health Service; national service; public service; room service;

def_cn: 随时可供…使用;随时为…提供帮助
def_en: To be at the service of a person or organization means to be available to help or be used by that person or organization.

def_cn: 随时为您效劳;随时听您的吩咐
def_en: You can use 'at your service' after your name as a formal way of introducing yourself to someone and saying that you are willing to help them in any way you can.

def_cn: 帮…一个忙;对…有益
def_en: If you do someone a service, you do something that helps or benefits them.

def_cn: (车辆、设备)在使用中,可以使用/(通常因发生故障而)未在使用
def_en: If a piece of equipment or type of vehicle is in service, it is being used or is able to be used. If it is out of service, it is not being used, usually because it is not working properly.

def_cn: 有用;有帮助
def_en: If someone or something is of service to you, they help you or are useful to you.
to be pressed into service→see: press;
